TextView.android:text: Measles causes fever, rash, cough, runny nose, and red, watery eyes, ear infection, diarrhea, pneumonia, brain damage, and death.Mumps causes fever, headache, muscle aches, tiredness, loss of appetite, and swollen salivary glands, swelling of the testicles or ovaries, deafness, meningitis and, rarely, death.Rubella, causes fever, sore throat, rash, headache, and red, itchy eyes. This disease can be prevented with safe, effective vaccination.It is recommended a two-dose vaccine schedule for measles, mumps, rubella and varicella vaccines for children, with the first dose at age 12-15 months and the second at age 4-6 years.
